title: Wisdom in Conduct
shortSummary: Proverbs 23 offers practical wisdom on self-control, integrity, and the pursuit of godly living. It warns against the dangers of greed, gluttony, and immoral relationships, while emphasizing the value of discipline, honoring parents, and seeking true wisdom. This chapter guides believers to live wisely in everyday situations, honoring God through their choices.

keyCharacters.name: The Son
keyCharacters.description: The primary recipient of the father's wisdom and instruction throughout the chapter, representing the learner or disciple.

keyCharacters.name: The Father
keyCharacters.description: The wise instructor who imparts guidance, correction, and encouragement to his son, embodying Godly wisdom.

keyCharacters.name: The Ruler
keyCharacters.description: A figure of authority with whom one might dine, symbolizing the need for careful conduct in the presence of power.

keyCharacters.name: The Strange Woman
keyCharacters.description: A metaphor for temptation and immorality, representing the dangers of adultery and sinful enticement.

definitions.definition: A boundary marker used to define property lines; metaphorically, it represents established rights and moral boundaries that should not be violated.
An instrument used for discipline or correction, symbolizing parental authority and the necessity of training children in righteousness.
One who defends or vindicates the rights of another; here, referring to God as the protector of the fatherless.
Those who habitually drink wine to excess; a warning against drunkenness and its consequences.
Delicacies or luxurious foods, often used metaphorically to describe tempting but deceitful pleasures.

outline.heading: Warnings about Appetite and Wealth
outline.description: Advises careful behavior when dining with rulers, warns against overindulgence and the deceitfulness of riches, emphasizing the fleeting nature of wealth.

outline.heading: Cautions Against Dishonest and Ungodly Associations
outline.description: Warns against accepting hospitality from those with evil intentions, highlighting the importance of discerning others’ true hearts.

outline.heading: Respect for Boundaries and the Fatherless
outline.description: Commands respect for property rights and protection of the vulnerable, reminding that God defends the fatherless.

outline.heading: Value of Instruction and Discipline
outline.description: Encourages wholehearted acceptance of wisdom and correction, affirming that discipline leads to life and brings joy to parents.

outline.heading: Warnings Against Envy and Excess
outline.description: Advises against envying sinners and indulging in drunkenness or gluttony, highlighting the ruin such behaviors bring.

outline.heading: Honor Parents and Pursue Wisdom
outline.description: Calls for honoring one’s parents and valuing truth, wisdom, and understanding as priceless possessions.

outline.heading: Dangers of Immorality and Drunkenness
outline.description: Vividly describes the destructive consequences of adultery and excessive drinking, portraying the physical and spiritual ruin they cause.

application: Exercise self-control in all areas of life, especially regarding appetite and the pursuit of wealth, trusting God’s provision.
Honor and obey parents as a reflection of respect for God’s order and receive the blessings that come with it.
Accept and apply godly discipline and correction to grow in wisdom and avoid destructive paths.
Avoid associations and behaviors that lead to moral compromise, such as drunkenness and sexual immorality.

keyVerses.text: Labour not to be rich: cease from thine own wisdom.
keyVerses.significance: This verse warns against the folly of pursuing wealth through human wisdom alone, encouraging reliance on God rather than material gain.

keyVerses.text: Withhold not correction from the child: for if thou beatest him with the rod, he shall not die.
keyVerses.significance: Emphasizes the necessity of discipline in child-rearing as a means of protection and moral formation.

keyVerses.text: Buy the truth, and sell it not; also wisdom, and instruction, and understanding.
keyVerses.significance: Highlights the priceless value of truth and wisdom, urging believers to acquire and hold fast to them at all costs.

keyVerses.text: Look not thou upon the wine when it is red, when it giveth his colour in the cup, when it moveth itself aright.
keyVerses.significance: A vivid warning against the allure of alcohol, cautioning believers to avoid its seductive and destructive effects.
